name: Vegan Buddha Bowl with Tahini Dressing
ingredients: 1 can (15 oz) chickpeas, drained and rinsed
2 cups kale, stems removed and chopped
steps:
Preheat oven to 400Â°F.
Toss cubed sweet potatoes with 1 tablespoon olive oil, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Spread sweet potatoes on a baking sheet and roast for 20-25 minutes until tender and slightly caramelized.
While sweet potatoes roast, cook quinoa in vegetable broth according to package instructions (about 15-20 minutes). Fluff and let cool.
Drain and rinse chickpeas, then pat dry.
Heat remaining olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add chickpeas and cook for 5-6 minutes until slightly crispy. Season with salt and pepper.
In a large bowl, massage kale with a drizzle of olive oil and a pinch of salt until leaves are tender and darker in color.
Prepare tahini dressing: whisk together tahini, lemon juice, maple syrup, minced garlic, and 2-3 tablespoons of water until smooth and creamy. Add more water if needed to reach desired consistency.
To assemble bowls: Start with a base of quinoa in each bowl.
Add roasted sweet potatoes, crispy chickpeas, massaged kale, cherry tomatoes, and shredded red cabbage.
Drizzle generously with tahini dressing.
Garnish with pumpkin seeds and serve immediately.
